messages.message:
We seem to have a regression with the way we display the output of extracted tables using FR. I’ll need to do a different demo for an insurance customer today as you can’t read any of the writing.

https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1094

Cc @Subash @Aayush 
Can you investigate this on priority ?
Would you be able to share the document?

Created this fix: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/50742
Do we need changes in this testmo case to capture this? https://instabase.testmo.net/runs/view/33?group_id=325&test_id=14092
definitely need to add this to the test data if this is an edge; but i think you can capture this with a unit test, this looks like horizontal scrolling was not implemented correctly
Yup not sure what caused this - this should be a regression, I remember it working earlier
Slawek reported the same thing in sandbox i believe

yeah please add this to testmo's testing data, but let's see if we can add unit tests first. this is Slawek's thread https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C0516UPPMT3/p1701775764408849 cc @Travis as he said he was going to look into it
@Aayush can you pick this fix to 23.47 and 49, thanks
Converted the PR to draft, looking more into this. Ideally it should not always be unwrapped
I upgraded this ticket to a blocker -- this likely will break a lot of demo, I will announce it soon
Should be good to merge now: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/50742
i'll merge after they pass the test, and work with infra to repush some time today
sorry I didn’t come back to this yesterday. But ultimately this will have to be a testmo case. Not sure how a unit test could verify this one.
~looks like it’s ok in Build Results~ scratch that
i checked the pr -- this is setting word-break to the default value so should be fine
Do we need separate change for build or this covers rendering in build too ?
this should cover both
@Travis @Aayush please work to resolve travis' comment in the PR soon -- i'll merge it afterwards
I’m still drilling into this to see if our CSS had a change somewhere that would do this. Are we sure that tables with a lot of columns were working ok previously?
yeah Aayush digged a bit, the table component is affected by a recent change in the parent wrapper; the fix is to hard-set it to the default value
Ok cool.
